intro: Claoxylon preussii, commonly known as the African sandalwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and dense, aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or woodland areas. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is sometimes cultivated for its timber and fragrant properties.
